publication.title: A Global Grid for Analysis of Arthropod Evolution
publication.authors: craig a. stewart,rainer keller,richard repasky,matthias hess,david hart,matthias s. müller,ray sheppard,uwe wössner,huian li ii,donald k. berry,john colbourne
publication.keyword: Computational Grid;Distributed Application;Evolutionary History;Genetics;Grid Computing;Maximum Likelihood;
publication.abstract: Maximum likelihood analysis is a powerful technique for inferring evolutionary histories from genetic sequence data. During the fall of 2003, an international team of computer scientists, biologists, and computer centers created a global grid to analyze the evolution of hexapods (arthropods with six legs).
